description: This course will focus on the role of microorganisms in human health and infectious diseases. It will include a description of the main types of microorganisms, how they are identified, their growth requirements, the role of the immune system in controlling infections, the control of animal parasites including viruses, bacteria and fungi and host - microbe interactions.
name: MICROBIOLOGY

values.comments:
Nursing 063 focuses on the role of microorganisms in human health and infectious diseases. It will include a description of the main types of microorganisms, how they are identified, their growth requirements, the role of the immune system in controlling infections, the control of animal parasites including viruses, bacteria and fungi and host - microbe interactions.

 Most students agreed there was a lot of information presented for such a short class. Many students enjoyed the class and “saw the connection to nursing,” while fewer thought the class was “too rushed.”

Students enjoyed Professor Wislowski and appreciated that she stressed how microbiology connects to nursing practice.

This course is required for nursing students, usually taken in the fall semester of freshman year.
